content.description: This climbs the West face of the spire. Climb a shallow, flaring crack to its end. Here step right follow an arete past a bolt to the top and a bolted anchor.
content.protection: A single rack to 2" plus a red tri-cam.
content.location: It ascends a spire just below big belay ledge.

content.description: Climb cracks up an arete. When the cracks end, continue up the arete (if you are unable to lasso the top of arete with a 48" runner, this climb may feel more of a R rating). Traverse right to a bolted anchor.
content.protection: A singles rack 00 to 2" plus RPs.
content.location: It is on the far left side of the cliff past a belay ledge and spire.

content.description: Climb a thin crack to a ledge under a roof, pull roof through weakness on its left side, and continue up easy hand crack to the top with a bolted anchor.
content.protection: A singles rack to 4" and doubles of 1".
content.location: It is on the far left side of the cliff uphill from belay ledge and spire.

content.description: Climb a short, right-facing corner to a ledge. Here face climb up to a bolt and further to a seam/tips crack. Follow this to its end, and continue up on amazing holds to a bolted anchor.
content.protection: A singles rack to 3" and RPs.
content.location: It is the furthest left climb on a big belay ledge.

content.description: Climb a right-facing corner, and pull a roof to gain crack and face climbing on amazing holds to the top. Step right to a bolted anchor.
content.location: Start on the left side of a big ledge.

content.description: Climb a right-facing corner/thin crack that widens. Climb up and left on easy terrain to a roof with amazing holds, pull the roof, and climb to the top (protected by tricky gear) to a bolted anchor.
content.protection: A singles rack 00-3" and doubles of hands-sized pieces.
content.location: Start in the center of a big ledge.

content.description: Climb up a block, traverse out right on good holds, and pull a roof with a big throw to a finger lock (the crux). Then follow a thin crack to easy terrain with amazing holds to the top with a bolted anchor.
content.location: Start on the left side of a big ledge.

content.description: Face climb to a bolt, and continue up flakes to easy terrain. Here climb up a wide crack (that narrows to hands) just right of a roof, and follow it to the top with a bolted anchor.
content.protection: A singles rack 0.2-3" with optional doubles of hands.
content.location: It is on the right side of a big ledge.

content.description: Climb a tips crack to a horizontal. Here, stand up, clip a bolt, and face climb to the top (bolted anchor).
content.location: It is on the left side of the spire.

content.description: Climb a shallow, left-facing corner system. Face climb past a bolt to the next shallow, left-facing corner system/thin crack, and follow it to the top with a bolted anchor.
content.location: Start on the ground at the tallest part of the cliff just right of a big ledge.
